tp:treatment-sec.p: Moderately common in Northwestern Europe (Buhl & Jałoszyński 2016); Germany (Buhl et al. 2016); Iran .

Dasyneura brassicae (Winnertz, 1853)
(Dip.: Cecidomyiidae ) on
Brassica sp.
may be a host ( Vlug 1995 ; O’Connor & Buhl 2016 ).

Our studied specimens are similar to
S. lugubre
but with having the following morphological character can be separated from it: larger, with lighter body appendages, stronger hind lamella on scutellum.
